intro: Licaria cannella subsp. tenuicarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruit licaria, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, woolly leaves. Its flowers are typically pale pink or white, with five petals and stamens. The subspecies is distinguished by its narrow, elongated fruits and is often found in dry, open habitats.
